results.title: Blank check
results.creator_credit: Rupert Wainwright, Gary Adelson, Craig Baumgarten and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: When 11-year-old Preston Waters’ bicycle is hit by a crook on the run, a hastily scrawled blank cheque sets the wheels in motion for the spending spree of a lifetime. Cast includes Brian Bonsall, Karen Duffy, Miguel Ferrer.

results.title: Sailor beware = Panic in the parlour
results.creator_credit: Gordon Parry, Jack Clayton, Romulus Films and British Lion Films
results.brief_description: From the stage play “Sailor beware” by Philip King and Falkland L. Cary with an introduction by Bill Collins. A humorous tale of domestic conflict between Shirley (Shirley Eaton), her prospective sailor husband-to-be Albert (Ronald Lewis) and Shirley’s overbearing acerbic tongued mother, Emma (Peggy Mount). Cast includes Cyril Smith, Esme Cannon, Gordon jackson, Geoffrey Keen, Joy Webster, Thora Hird.

results.title: Flying down to Rio
results.creator_credit: Thornton Freeland and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: This wonderful nostalgic film celebrates not only the Hollywood musical but more importantly and historically, it was also the first film that Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire teamed together and set the world alight with their magical dance movements. On-screen dancing would never be the same again. Electrifying, mesmerising, Rogers and Astaire outshone even the top-billed stars Dolores Del Rio, Gene Raymond and Raul Roulien. Forget the plot, just enjoy the whole musical experience.

results.title: Rosalie
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke, William Anthony McGuire and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A rich and lively blend of great songs, great dances, great comedy and plain old period charm, Rosalie is the kind of zany musical they just don’t make anymore. Starring Nelson Eddy as Dick Thorpe, star footballer and West Point cadet and Eleanor Powell as Rosalie, the woman he loves. Cast also includes Frank Morgan, Edna May Oliver, Ray Bolger, Ilona Massey with words and music by Cole Porter. Based on the play by William Anthony McGuire and Guy Bolton. The film is introduced by Bill Collins.

results.title: Hey babe
results.creator_credit: Rafal Zielinski, Arthur Voronka, Institut Quebecois, Canadian Film Development Corporation and Rafal Productions
results.brief_description: Starstruck 12-year-old Theresa (Yasmine Bleeth), a streetwise orphan, is determined to find fame and success in the show-business industry but it is not until she meets up with Buddy (Buddy Hackett), an aging vaudeville performer, that her dream finally becomes reality. Cast also includes Marushka Stankova, Vlasta Vrana, Denise Proulx.

results.title: Little Johnny Jones
results.creator_credit: Gary Halvorson, Bill Siegler, Showtime Entertainment and Group W Cable Productions
results.brief_description: This Goodspeed Opera House production of George M. Cohan’s classic American musical “Little Johnny Jones” is performed on stage in front of a live audience and features such hit songs as “Yankee Doodle Dandy” and “Give my regards to Broadway”. The cast includes Eric Weitz as Johnny Jones and Peter Van Norden as Anthony Anstey, with Lenny Wolpe, Ernie Sabella, Bruce Chew, Jack Bittner, Maureen Brennan, Anna Mcneely, Jane Galloway. Book, music and lyrics by George M. Cohan adapted by Alfred Uhry and stage direction by Gerald Gutierrez.

results.title: Babes in toyland
results.brief_description: Santa Claus’s incompetent assistants accidentally make some giant wooden soldiers, which come in useful when a villian tries to take over Toyland. A musical fantasy based on the Operetta by Victor Herbert and Glen McDonough with music adapted and conducted by George Bruns and choreography by Tom Mahoney. Stars Ray Bolger, Tommy Sands, Annette Funicello, Ed Wynn.

results.title: Yes, Giorgio
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Peter Fetterman, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy about an opera singer who loses his voice, the beautiful doctor who helps him find it, and the love affair which results. Includes an extensive segment from the opera, Turandot. Stars Luciano Pavarotti as Giorgio, Kathryn Harrold and Eddie Albert. Original music composed and conducted by Michael J. Lewis. Contains some scenes in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: This is the army
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B. Wallis, Jack L. Warner, Thirtieth Cemalux, Hollywood House Video and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In World War I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In World War II his son Johnny Jones, previously his father’s assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called “This is the army”. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiance until the war is over. Cast includes George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Alan Hale, Kate Smith, and men from the armed forces including Ronald Reagan and Joe Louis. Based on the play by Irving Berlin, music and lyrics by Irving Berlin. Includes bonus blooper footage of Ronald Reagan in rehearsal. Note: “Copyright Thirtieth Cemalux Pty Ltd 1986”

results.title: Follow the fleet
results.creator_credit: Mark Sandrich, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Hubert Osborne’s play “Shore leave”, this romantic comedy musical features that wonderful dancing duo, Fred Astaire as Bake Baker, a sailor, and Ginger Rogers as Sherry Martin, a dance-hall hostess. Although playing more of a supportive role to Randolph Scott and Harriet Hilliard, the Fred and Ginger team put in an unforgettable performance with “Let’s face the music and dance”. Cast also includes Betty Grable and Lucille Ball. Lyrics and music by Irving Berlin.
